info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 4:42PM EST until February 28 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. * WHERE...Eastern New York along and just east of the Hudson River. Also northern Herkimer county in the western Adirondacks and eastern Winham County in southern Vermont. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could especially impact the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall will range from only around 3 inches along and just east of the Hudson River to up to 7 inches at higher elevations. Snow will be heaviest between 9 pm this evening to 5 am Tuesday, with rates around 0.5 inches per hour.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
